commitResults.messageTitle: changed Duke.java to Jackson.java changed greeting
added add and list functions, segregated add and list into separate global methods
Added marking and unmarking functionality into chatbot loop
Added Deadline, Event and Todo class files, changed main loop from switch statement to if else (because it's easier for me), established regex parsing of input and tidied up code
Added custom exception files, modified main loop to utilise REGEX (for neater and shorter code)
Added delete method and improved Exceptions to include: invalid index (0) and invalid index (above list size)
Integrated "bye" detection into if-else loop, added secret function
Added encryption for secret text file
Grouped Exceptions under JacksonException, removed redundant InvalidIndexException
Added enums for Response type checking
Added JacksonException as the parent Exception class for Jackson-specific exceptions, standardized all JacksonExceptions to take in a String msg during construction
Created Response, TaskList and Parser class to handle Action type and Matcher, task list amendments and input parsing respectively
Updated UI testing files for the latest version of Jackson
Added javadocs to existing methods/variables and comments describing main loop

commitResults.messageBody:
Javadocs description does not adhere to coding standards.

Javadocs have to conform to standards according to course demands.

Let's rewrite Javadocs to adhere to standards in terms of description.

commitResults.messageTitle: TaskList: Remove showList, add overloaded toString
commitResults.messageBody:
TaskList currently uses showList to show the task list

This is not generalisable as we now have to be able to show and save
tasks to file.

Let's remove showList and implement a more flexible toString
implementation so it can be used for both "list" and "save" commands.

TaskList currently cannot save the list to a text file after every
modification.

Upon saving, users can retrieve task list history if needed.

Let's add the save function to write the task list history into a
text file in real-time.

Currently, Jackson does not save the task list after changes and
cannot load a previously saved task list.

This means every time we start Jackson, we have to waste time
re-entering all the tasks, which is cumbersome and not functional.

Let's add this save and load function such that the tasks can be
written and read from a save file data.txt to ensure continuity of
memory across Jackson runs.
* Modify TaskList to include save and load methods
* Add regex to read tasks from the save text file more easily
* Modify TaskList modification methods (addList, deleteList, etc)
to save after each method call
* Add Exception checking for IOExceptions
* Remove toString method as it might be redundant and reinstate
showList

Secret command is too obvious

Thus, users can guess functionality based on the command itself

Let's change the command to make it less obvious

Previously, there was no restriction on dates for Event and
Deadline classes.

Thus, there was no standardized format for users to input their
from, to and by dates.

Let's do a few things here:
* Create Temporal class to handle DateTime/Date information storage
* Create DateTimeFormatters to output datetime accordingly
* Modify Event and Deadline classes to contain Temporal class
objects
* Modify Temporal class to be able to read saved dates and
datetimes (which have already been converted to output datetime
format)

Get rid of unused imports in Jackson and Parser, as well as
modifying regex patterns to comply with accepted datetime input
format

commitResults.messageTitle: More OOP: Add new class files
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, Jackson.java handled most of the functionality for the
chatbot (eg. User Interaction and Save File input-output), which
made the file messy and convoluted.

In addition, TaskList.java also had untidy code due to placing too
much functionality in one file. Overall code was not segmented well
in accordance to OOP principles.

Let's do a few changes:
* Create new Ui class to handle printing output and exceptions
* Transfer printing responsibility from Jackson to Ui
* Create new Storage class to handle save file input-output
* Transfer read-write duties from TaskList to Storage
* Change Jackson from static to instance class
* Separate main and run methods in Jackson, so now main creates
instance of Jackson and runs the main loop instead
* Other code standard changes (naming, etc)

commitResults.messageTitle: Javadocs: Add java docs to Temporal and newly created classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Add javadocs for methods and variables in Temporal, Storage, Ui,
Jackson and TaskList

Files were disorganised without partitions to organise them.

Let's separate all of them into packages for better organisation.

Files were disorganised previously.

If not organised properly, files can be hard to find and import.

Let's separate all the files into respective packages.

commitResults.messageTitle: Comments: Change comments to be clearer
